Preliminary Survey of Programs
September 1991 Offerings NA3SB Tape Network
July 12, 1991
It is proposed that the NAEB tape network begin an extended operation toy
offering a minimum of five hours of programming weekly starting the week of
September 16, 1991*
Since it is apparent that it is going to take some little time to obtain the
mass duplicating equipment, it will be necessary to use the bicycle method
with the stations organised into legs for the first few months. A tentative
plan has the present sixty-six stations organised into eight geographic legs*
It is anticipated that a rigid master schedule will be arranged for this block
of five weekly hours* This schedule will stay in effect even though stations
take only part of the programs offered. In this way the problem of initial
scheduling will be greatly simplified, and it will be possible for the stations
to know well in advance when they will receive the various programs* This is
a poor substitute for what we will be able to do when we can schedule all programs
for the same week on all stations, but that must await the duplicator.
It is not intended that this be all of the programming offered. Extra
programs will be offered individually, perhaps to start on the opposite end
of the legs as that of the block of five hours.
It is also believed that as time goes on we will be able to establish
a minimum number of weekly programming hours. This basic package we can
balance as to type and content. In addition to the basic package we can continue
to make available individual series as they become available.
